alert.note: Alert for Northern Nassau; Southern Nassau (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 3:52PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...MODERATE SNOWFALL POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON... A band of moderate snow will move into the area between 400 PM and 430 PM. Visibilities may be quickly reduced to 1/2 mile as gusty northwest winds continue. Up to an additional inch of snowfall is possible before the snow tapers off and ends early this evening. Wind gusts of 45 to 50 mph are likely into tonight, and a Wind Advisory remains in effect until 400 AM EDT. Temperatures in the lower 30s continue to fall, and will be in the mid 20s by early this evening, and reach lows around 20 degrees overnight. Gusty northwest wind will produce wind chill values of 10 to 15 this evening and as low as 2 to 5 above zero overnight. Motorists should exercise extra caution as snow develops and be prepared for rapid changes in visibility. Also, untreated surfaces may become slippery this afternoon and this evening as temperatures continue to fall.
